radiographic_examinations.findings: The sigmoid colon is diffusely thickened. The mesentery of the sigmoid colon shows diffuse fatty stranding and contains small locules of air. Sigmoid colon also contains multiple diverticula. No pulmonary nodule, parenchymal opacification, or pleural effusion at the bases. The liver, gallbladder, spleen, adrenal glands, kidneys, pancreas, and duodenum are normal. No free fluid noted within the pelvis. No pathologically enlarged pelvic or inguinal nodes. Incidental injection granuloma of the left gluteal region. No concerning lytic or sclerotic lesion.
